newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia Yield Spreads-Show defiance to U.S..
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia Yield Spreads-Show defiance to U.S..

text.p: The Australian debt market showed some defiance to the meaty sell-off in U.S. Treasuries on Wednesday, particularly at the short-end, causing yield spread differentials to compress.
The local market also outperformed the Canadian market, but was mixed against New Zealand after its NZ$100 million Treasury bond tender fetched reasonable demand.
The U.S. market dropped heavily following hawkish comments by Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan at his Humphrey-Hawkins testimony.

But while the domestic bonds followed suit in after hours trading, the dayside accounts had positioned themsleves for a bearish outcome and recovered on profit-taking on short positions, traders said.

The market was also boosted by further signs of moderating wages growth in the final average weekly earnings data for the November quarter and a larger than expected fall in December quarter capital expediture.
